text: Joseph Kamwendo (born 23 October 1986) is a retired Malawian international footballer. He is now coaching Walter Nyamilandu Football Academy. https://malawi24.com/2019/12/23/joseph-kamwendo-announces-his-retirement/ ==Career== Kamwendo was the first foreigner to be bestowed the Soccer Star of the Year in Zimbabwe. In 2005, he received the award as a player of CAPS United. In November 2013, he joined TP Mazembe on a five-year deal.# On 23 December 2019, 33-year old Kamwendo announced his retirement from football.Joseph Kamwendo announces his retirement, malawi24.com, 23 December 2019 ==External links== * * ==References== Category:1986 births Category:Living people Category:People from Blantyre Category:Malawian footballers Category:Malawian expatriate footballers Category:Malawi international footballers Category:2010 Africa Cup of Nations players Category:FC Nordsjælland players Category:Orlando Pirates F.C. players Category:TP Mazembe players Category:Mighty Wanderers FC players Category:CAPS United players Category:Vasco da Gama (South Africa) players Category:Liga Desportiva de Maputo players Category:CS Don Bosco players Category:National First Division players Category:South African Premier Division players Category:Danish Superliga players Category:Association football midfielders Category:FIFA Century Club Category:Malawian expatriate sportspeople in South Africa Category:Malawian expatriate sportspeople in the Democratic Republic of the Congo Category:Malawian expatriate sportspeople in Mozambique Category:Expatriate footballers in Denmark Category:Expatriate footballers in Zimbabwe Category:Expatriate soccer players in South Africa Category:Expatriate footballers in the Democratic Republic of the Congo
title: Joseph Kamwendo
